alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 14 at 12:25AM CDT until June 14 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MITCHELL COUNTY... At 1225 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that between 2 and 4 inches of rain had fallen from thunderstorms on Tuesday evening, with some light rain still lingering early this morning. Although very little additional rain is expected this morning, flash flooding could still be ongoing in parts of the area from the earlier heavy rain. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges, including a personal weather station 5 miles north-northeast of Hunter that has measured 3.48 inches of rain since earlier Tuesday evening. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mainly rural areas near Hunter, and extending roughly 5 to 8 miles northwest through northeast of Hunter. This includes the following streams and drainages... North Branch Spillman Creek, Little Salt Creek, Walnut Creek, Bacon Creek, West Rock Creek, Carr Creek, Rock Creek and Salt Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
